I think that using smell (taste in this case, but it is essentially the same sense) to communicate is pretty much hard wired into all mammals. For 100 million years or so before the extinction of the dinosaurs our ancestors were largely nocturnal burrow dwellers that were likely social to some degree. Using smell to communicate makes a lot of sense in those conditions. Other vertebrates use smell to hunt but few if any utilize it much for communication. Many insects do though.
